summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum dated July 23, 2019, documenting an interview with an inmate regarding an incident with his cellmate, Jeffrey Edward Epstein. The incident involved Epstein allegedly touching the inmate's foot while he was sleeping, leading the inmate to call for staff assistance. The document also provides background on Epstein's status and disciplinary record.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: He is the inmate (BOP #76318-054) who is the subject of the incident report. He is described as sitting on the ground staring at the reporting inmate after the inmate felt something hit his foot while sleeping.

events.title: Interview regarding cell incident with Epstein
events.description: An interview was conducted with an inmate regarding an incident that occurred with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. The inmate reported that while sleeping on the floor past midnight, he felt something hit his foot, woke up, and observed Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him.

events.title: Inmate's prior disciplinary incident
events.description: The inmate reporting the incident had a prior disciplinary report for 'Fighting with Another' in February 2018.

locations: 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007 (Federal Bureau of Prisons Office address)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a pre-trial inmate at the time of this document (July 23, 2019).
Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for being in possession of a cell phone.
An incident occurred where Epstein's cellmate reported feeling something hit his foot while sleeping and waking to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him.
The reporting inmate had a 'Separation' assignment and a chronological disciplinary record, with a prior incident for fighting in February 2018.
Epstein's pending charges at the time included murder and drug conspiracy under statute 21:848(E).
